oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EROSION OF THE DAMIETTA PROMONTORY, THE NILE DELTA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fanos, A.M.
Khafagy, A.A.
Komar, P.D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nile Delta
Damietta Promontory
erosion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Damietta sediment-formed promontory is located on the eastern half of the Nile Delta, about 40 km west of the Suez Canal breakwaters at Port Said. Following a long period of accretion, the promontory began to erode early this century with shoreline recession rates reaching a maximum of 38 m/yr. This paper documents the shoreline changes, the coastal processes responsible for those changes, and the protective measures that have been erected to control the erosion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
